intro: Adenocline sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flowered adenocline, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers and aromatic properties. The plant is characterized by its small, sessile leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat obscure species within its family.
